articles.title: Payton Pritchard addresses his shooting woes as Celtics struggle as a whole
articles.description:
"I'll have a lot of good shooting days ahead so I'm not worried about that."

The post Payton Pritchard addresses his shooting woes as Celtics struggle as a whole appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Payton Pritchard acknowledges his shooting struggles amid Celtics' overall performance issues.
Celtics' recent games show a decline in team shooting percentages, affecting fan morale.
Pritchard remains optimistic, promising better shooting days ahead for Boston fans.

articles.title: How Mass. native Georges Niang reacted to Celtics’ decision to trade him
articles.description:
"Obviously ... you want to play for your hometown team, but I don't think as a professional athlete you have enough time to be heartbroken."

The post How Mass. native Georges Niang reacted to Celtics’ decision to trade him appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Georges Niang expressed disappointment over being traded from the Celtics.
Niang, a Massachusetts native, valued playing for his hometown team.
The trade impacts Celtics' roster dynamics ahead of the upcoming season.

articles.title: FBI: Two Mass. men arrested in Harvard Medical School explosion
articles.description:
Harvard University police said the explosion happened shortly before 3 a.m. Saturday at the Goldenson Building on Longwood Avenue.

The post FBI: Two Mass. men arrested in Harvard Medical School explosion appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Explosion occurred at Harvard Medical School's Goldenson Building around 3 a.m. on Saturday.
Two Massachusetts men have been arrested in connection with the incident.
Local residents are concerned about safety following the explosion at a prominent institution.

articles.title: ‘This has nothing to do with us,’ BPD commissioner says amid Karen Read attorney’s calls for disciplinary review
articles.description:
“I’m not going to speak on this again,” an adamant Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox said Monday.

The post ‘This has nothing to do with us,’ BPD commissioner says amid Karen Read attorney’s calls for disciplinary review appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox stated the department is not involved in the Karen Read case.
Cox emphasized he will not comment further on this matter, maintaining departmental boundaries.
The statement may affect public perception of police accountability in Boston.

articles.title: Missing Worcester woman found dead in car
articles.description:
Joanna Brown was last seen leaving work on Friday.

The post Missing Worcester woman found dead in car appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Joanna Brown, a Worcester woman, was found dead in her car after going missing.
She was last seen leaving work on Friday, November 3, 2025.
Her death raises concerns about safety and community support in the Worcester area.
